account.desc_start: This command prints informations about an account.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide which user the informations should be about.

blog.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
blog.desc_start: This command prints the last 10 posts you've made.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts being printed.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide which user the blog should be from.

blog.quick_desc: prints the last posts you've made.

close.desc_start: This subcommand closes an opened post and reprints the list of posts previously printed.

comments.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
comments.desc_start: This command prints the last 10 comments you've made.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of comments being printed.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide which user the comments should be from.

comments.quick_desc: prints the last comments you've made.

created.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
created.desc_start: This command prints the last 10 posts created.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts being printed.

params.name: tag
params.text: lets you choose a specific tag the posts must have.

feed.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
feed.desc_start: This command prints the 10 latest posts from your feed.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts being printed.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide which user the feed should be from.

feed.quick_desc: prints the last posts from your feed.

help.desc_start: This command prints a list of all the existing commands.

important_param.name: command
important_param.text: prints a more in depth explanation for a given command.

params.name: command
params.text: prints a more in depth explanation for a given command.

help.quick_desc: prints a list of existing commands.

hot.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
hot.desc_start: This command prints the 10 hotted posts.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts being printed.

params.name: tag
params.text: lets you choose a specific tag the posts must have.

mentions.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
mentions.desc_start: This command prints the last 10 posts and comments you were mentioned in.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts and/or comments being printed.

params.name: type
params.text: lets you decide whether you want to get only posts ('posts' or 'p') or only comments ('comments', 'coms' or 'c'). By default, this command will print both.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide which user the posts and/or comments should mention.

mentions.quick_desc: prints the last posts and comments you were mentioned in.

next.desc_start: This subcommand prints the post that comes after the currently opened post in a list of posts previously printed.
next.quick_desc: opens the post following a currently opened post.

open.desc_end: This subcommand works with results obtained from the following commands: blog, comments, created, feed, hot, replies, trending.
open.desc_start: This subcommand prints any chosen post from a list of posts. If no index is specified, the first post will be printed. Writing 'open' is not required, just writing the index is enough.

params.name: index
params.text: lets you decide which post to open by specifying its index from a previously generated list of posts.

open.quick_desc: opens a post from a previously generated list of posts.

previous.desc_start: This subcommand prints the post that comes before the currently opened post in a list of posts previously printed.
previous.quick_desc: opens the post preceding a currently opened post.

replies.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
replies.desc_start: This command prints the 10 latest replies to your posts and comments.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of replies being printed.

params.name: user
params.text: lets you decide to which user the replies should be.

replies.quick_desc: prints the last replies to your posts and comments.

set.desc_end: These parameters must be used separetely and, contrary to all other commands, their name must be written. Don't forget to write a value after those parameters !
set.desc_start: This command lets you change your settings.

params.name: steem_account
params.text: sets a default Steem account so you don't have to type it when looking at your blog, feed, comments and replies. This parameter must be followed by a Steem username.

params.name: styling
params.text: switches the text styling (bold and italic) on or off. This parameter can be followed by 'true' (for 'on') or 'false' (for 'off'). If no value is given, it will simply switch its state.

set.quick_desc: lets the user change his settings.

trending.desc_end: These parameters can be used together. No specific order is required.
trending.desc_start: This command prints the 10 most trending posts.

params.name: quantity
params.text: lets you decide the quantity of posts being printed.

params.name: tag
params.text: lets you choose a specific tag the posts must have.
